column4: why do i keep getting an error writing to my disc when finalizing it?
using gnome's builtin cd burning
did you try lower speeds?
what is the error exactly?
don't think it gives anything specific. just says try lower speed, so i tried one lower. but the disc is up to 52x which i tried lower than
can you do tail -v /var/log/messages in a terminal when burning, maybe it shows some output
sorry i mean tail -f /var/log/messages
what kind of brand media you use?
professional optical storage... never have problems before
did you have problems with the latest up-to-date ubuntu, or do you have some older version
8.0.4 in both cases
you could try upgrading to 8.10 or 9.04 when its released this month
well i need to burn a disc now.. maybe another program?
dpkg-reconfigure sun-java6-jre
i had good results with k3b
try aptitude install
it's not installed so i can't do that
aptitude can help with some dependency problems, otherwise try first apt-get update
with aptitude?
yes
looks like it was too long of a filename, and k3b caught it
good, i always use k3b it works well
